Dearborn, MI, 48128-1784
Re: License #: CB820201219
Dear Ms. Brail:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
12/7/2023. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3317

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
R400.12607(4) Adoption recommendation.
• The agency is apprised it shall consistently show documentation that it
has provided the adoptive family a signed copy of the adoptive family
assessment/updated adoptive family assessment regardless of the
briefness/ number of pages of that assessment.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R400.12605(2) Adoptive family evaluation.
• The agency was advised clearly showing the date each respective
household member was interviewed and or observed and noting it as such
may aid it in illustrating clear compliance to the rule.
R400.12712(1) Supervision.
• The agency was advised clearly and consistently documenting its post
adoption contact as a contact within the adoptive family's home may aid it
in illustrating clear compliance to the rule.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator provided an assessment report dated 11/27/2023. No
concerns were noted.
Financial Overview
The agency provided an annual program budget. No concerns were observed
with that document. The agency is a very small adoption agency, and it has
received a variance with respect to not being required to submit an annual
independent financial audit.
Staff and Youth Interviews
A discussion was had with chief administrator/supervisor during the inspection
related to the agency’s program, staff and adoption statuses. A contractual
adoption worker was also interviewed, and no concerns or problems were
indicated.
This is not an independent living program. No youths were required to be
interviewed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A view of the facility did not indicate any concerns of safety issues.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Not applicable. This is a non-contract adoption agency.
3

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
December 13, 2023
________________________________________
Lonia Perry Calloway Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
December 14, 2023
